abstracts.cdata!:
The Morocco Fes Medina Rehabilitation
            Project had an unsatisfactory outcome, although its
            sustainability is likely and its institutional development
            impact is modest. The performances of both the Bank and the
            Borrower are rated unsatisfactory. Several lessons were
            cited from this project experience. They are in brief: 1)
            Reversing the urban decay of historic cities is a long-term
            endeavor. 2) Social participation is essential for the
            successful rehabilitation of the historic housing stock. 3)
            The tenure of land and buildings is a critical difficulty in
            the rehabilitation of historic cities. 4) Municipalities
            should consider delegating urban rehabilitation operations
            to competent agencies. 5) Urban rehabilitation projects
            should be designed according to simple objectives and
            design. 6) Project restructuring, when needed, should take
            place and be formalized as early as possible.
